Authors: Syahputra M.E., Hutabarat D.P., Budijono S., Lukas J.
Title: Eco Friendly Emergency Alert System (EFEAS) based on microcontroller and android application
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Syahputra, M.E., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Eco Friendly Emergency Alert System (EFEAS) is a home security system that aims to help residents to get emergency response assistance when a threat enters their home. EFEAS is developed using a microcontroller, android application and solar panel devices. Microcontroller is used to develop a main device of EFEAS that functions to activate siren, send SMS, switch electrical power from solar panels to conventional source or vice versa, and communicate with an android smartphone. Android application is developed and used to connect the android smartphone to the system. This system will activate sirene, send alerts and the location of the house when the panic button pushed by the user. With the implementation of this system residents are expected to be able to get faster handling when there are hazardous conditions in the house. This system developed can achieve the objective of being able to be operated using an Android smartphone to control all components within the system with 100% successful rate to send SMS within 13 seconds and 100% successful rate to switch between solar panel and adaptor. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: Android Application; Arduino Uno; ESP8266; Home security system; Panic button
Index Keywords: Controllers; Environmental protection; Fasteners; Microcontrollers; Security systems; Signaling; Smartphones; Solar cell arrays; Solar concentrators; Android applications; Arduino Uno; ESP8266; Home security systems; Panic button; Android (operating system)

Authors: Susanto R., Wijaya R., Talok A., Hartono J.R., Hedwig R., Lukas J., Dewanto S.
Title: Stabilizing system for quadrotor copter like flying robot by using proportional-integral-derivative (PID) controller
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Talok, A., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, J.R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewanto, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this research, a quardrotor copter like a flying robot is developed with its capability to stabilize itself during the steady flying in a determined position. In order to gain its stability, intentionally a simple filter with a low error rate of 1.67% during its full operation was placed. The time consumed during its steady flying in the air took approximately one second with the height of flying around 1 to 5 meters above the earth. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.

Authors: Atmadja W., Liawatimena S., Lukas J., Nata E.P.L., Alexander I.
Title: Hydroponic system design with real time OS based on ARM Cortex-M microcontroller
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Atmadja, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Liawatimena, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Nata, E.P.L., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Alexander, I., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Hydroponic is the process of growing plants without soil, plant root flooded or moist with nutrient-rich solutions in inert material. Hydroponics has become a reality for greenhouse growers in virtually all climates. Large hydroponic installations exist throughout the world for growing flowers, vegetables and some short period fruit like tomato and cucumber. In soilless culture, we must maintain stable pH and conductivity level of nutrient solution to make plant grow well, large variation of pH of certain time will poisoned plant. This paper describes development complete automation hydroponic system, from maintaining stable nutrient composition (conductivity and pH), grow light, and monitor plant environment such as CO2, temperature and humidity. The heart of our automation is ARM Cortex-M4 from ST Microelectronic running ARM mbed OS, the official Real Time Operating System (RTOS) for ARM Cortex-M microcontroller. Using RTOS gives us flexibility to have multithreaded process. Results show that system capable to control desired concentration level with variation of less than 3%, pH sensor show good accuracy 5.83% from pH value 3.23-10. Growing light intensity measurement show result 105 μmol/m2/s therefore we need turn on the light at least 17 hours/day to fulfil plant light requirement. RTOS give good performance with latency and jitter less than 15 us, system overall show good performance and accuracy for automating hydroponic plant in vegetative phase of growth. © 2017 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: ARM Cortex-M; growing light; Hydroponic; mbed OS; nutrient solution; RTOS
Index Keywords: Computer operating systems; Microcontrollers; Microelectronics; Nutrients; pH; pH sensors; Arm cortices; Hydroponic; Light-intensity measurement; Nutrient solution; Nutrient-rich solutions; Real time operating system; RTOS; Temperature and humidities; ARM processors

Authors: Azazi K., Andrean R., Atmadja W., Handi M., Lukas J.
Title: Design of Mobile Robot with Navigation Based on Embedded Linux
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Azazi, K., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Andrean, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Atmadja, W., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Handi, M., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to build and design a mobile robot that use a navigation system based on embedded Linux. The method of this research is by literature review method, experiment method and designing method. Analysis of the research will be done by collecting data and information from the reading of sensors that is used and compare the information that we get with the actual condition. The sensors are distance sensor IR Range, direction sensor digital compass module, camera and comparing latency of different Linux kernel. The result that we get are like the best reading distance of the distance sensor which is the IR Ranger are ±3-30 cm, digital compass module can read the value of a direction and produce the value well if there is not any material that contains magnetism that can disturb the reading of digital compass module, camera can detect object well by their color and by using the result of IR Ranger reading and digital compass module, robot can work and move independently in tracing the way and keep distance with the object. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Cameras; Computer operating systems; Linux; Machine design; Mobile robots; Navigation; Navigation systems; Actual conditions; Data and information; Designing methods; Direction sensors; Distance sensors; Embedded Linux; Experiment methods; Literature reviews; Robots

Title: Expert system for diagnosis pest and disease in fruit plants
Affiliations: Universitas Bina Nusantara, Computer Engineering Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Dewanto, S., Universitas Bina Nusantara, Computer Engineering Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Universitas Bina Nusantara, Computer Engineering Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper discussed the development of an expert system to diagnose pests and diseases on fruit plants. Rule base method was used to store the knowledge from experts and literatures. Control technique using backward chain and started from the symptoms to get conclusions about the pests and diseases that occur. Development of the system has been performed using software Corvid Exsys developed by Exsys company. Results showed that the development of this expert system can be used to assist users in identifying the type of pests and diseases on fruit plants. Further development and possibility of using internet for this system are proposed. © Owned by the authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2014.
References: Teknologi Tepat Guna,tentang Budi Daya Pertanian, , http://www.iptek.net.id/ind/; Joesi, E., Novizan, (2002) Mengendalikan Hama Dan Penyakit Tanaman, , PT Agro Media Pustaka, Depok; Turban, E., (1992) Expert System and Applied Artificial Intelligence, , Macmillan Publishing Company, Singapore; Marimin, (2002) Teori Dan Aplikasi Sistem Pakar Dalam Teknologi Manajerial, , IPB Press, Bogor; Thomas, M.B., Two computer-based diagnostic expert systems for disease, insect pests, and physiological disorders of citrus and selected tropical fruit crops (1997) HortTechnology, 7, pp. 293-298; Kemp, R.H., Stewart, T.M., Boorman, A., An expert system for diagnosis of pests, diseases, and disorders in apple crops (1989) New Zealand Journal of Crop and Horticultural Science, 17, pp. 89-96
